title: The Long-Term Cost of Volkswagen’s Emissions Scandal
text:
It has been four years since Volkswagen’s emissions scandal broke, yet the cost keeps on rising.

On Tuesday, German prosecutors filed charges against current VW Chief Executive Herbert Diess as well as the chairman and CEO who were in place when the Environmental Protection Agency served its shock “notice of violation” against the company in September 2015. The indictment alleges that the executives intentionally informed investors too late about the diesel fraud, making them guilty of market manipulation. The company and...
description: Whether in courts or dealerships, the effects of the car maker’s 2015 fraud will be playing out for years
